title: HalluciDet: Hallucinating RGB Modality for Person Detection Through Privileged Information
abstract: arXiv:2310.04662v2 Announce Type: replace-cross  Abstract: A powerful way to adapt a visual recognition model to a new domain is through image translation. However, common image translation approaches only focus on generating data from the same distribution as the target domain. Given a cross-modal application, such as pedestrian detection from aerial images, with a considerable shift in data distribution between infrared (IR) to visible (RGB) images, a translation focused on generation might lead to poor performance as the loss focuses on irrelevant details for the task. In this paper, we propose HalluciDet, an IR-RGB image translation model for object detection. Instead of focusing on reconstructing the original image on the IR modality, it seeks to reduce the detection loss of an RGB detector, and therefore avoids the need to access RGB data. translated_title: HalluciDet: 通过特权信息使RGB模态幻象用于人员检测
translated_abstract: 通过图像翻译是将视觉识别模型调整到新领域的有力方式。然而，常见的图像翻译方法仅专注于生成与目标域相同分布的数据。针对跨模态应用，如从航空图像进行行人检测，在红外（IR）到可见（RGB）图像之间存在数据分布上的显着偏移，专注于生成可能导致性能不佳，因为损失关注于任务的无关细节。本文提出了HalluciDet，一个用于目标检测的IR-RGB图像翻译模型。与专注于在IR模态上重建原始图像不同，该模型旨在减少RGB检测器的检测损失，从而避免访问RGB数据。该模型生成了一个新的图像表示，增强了场景中感兴趣的对象，并显著提高了检测性能。
tldr: 本文提出了一种IR-RGB图像翻译模型HalluciDet，通过特权信息减少RGB检测器的检测损失，提高了检测性能
en_tdlr: This paper introduces a IR-RGB image translation model, HalluciDet, that reduces the detection loss of an RGB detector through privileged information, improving the detection performance.
